docs.title: Tomas Gradowski
docs.text:
Electronics, Physics, Tech & Mathematics. Research, notes, and experiments.

  • Current: convex optimization, asymptotic statistics
  • Lab: Breadboard/PCB experiments — oscillators, SR latches, amplifiers
  • Code: Scripts, analysis, small tools

docs.title: Projects
docs.text:
• Analog lab — discrete transistor circuits, prototyping, instrumentation
  • Tools — small Python utilities for data/plots
  • Transverse Field Ising Model

docs.text:

docs.text:
Student in Mathematics & Physics. Interests: microelectronics, analog electronics, and applied math.

docs.title: Quantum Mechanics Summary
docs.text:
!!! note "About this summary" These notes summarize the key results, operators, and examples from the course, based on my own condensed material.

## PDF Summary 📘 Download the full summary (PDF)

## Topics covered - Foundations and measurement - Harmonic oscillator and ladder operators - Angular momentum and spin - Tensor products and entanglement

docs.title: Probability & Statistics Summary
docs.text:
About this summary

These notes collect key definitions, theorems, and worked examples from probability theory and statistics, focusing on clarity and conceptual connections.

docs.title: PDF Summary
docs.text: 📘 Download the full summary (PDF)

docs.title: Topics covered
docs.text:
• Random variables and probability distributions
  • Change of variable (Transport theorem)
  • Expectation, variance, and covariance
  • Law of Large Numbers and Central Limit Theorem
  • Estimation and confidence intervals
  • Hypothesis testing and regression

docs.title: Convex Optimization Summary
docs.text:
About this summary

These notes summarize the theoretical foundations and algorithms of convex optimization, emphasizing the link between geometry, duality, and computational methods.

docs.title: PDF Summary
docs.text: 📘 Download the full summary (PDF)

docs.title: Topics covered
docs.text:
• Convex sets and convex functions
  • Optimization problems and feasibility
  • Lagrange duality and KKT conditions
  • Gradient, subgradient, and projected methods
  • Newton’s method and barrier functions
  • Applications in data fitting and machine learning

docs.title: Solid Mechanics Summary
docs.text:
About this summary

This summary outlines the theoretical and computational foundations of solid mechanics, including stress analysis, strain, and constitutive laws.

docs.title: PDF Summary
docs.text: 📘 Download the full summary (PDF)

docs.title: Topics covered
docs.text:
• Stress tensor and equilibrium equations
  • Strain tensor and compatibility
  • Elasticity and Hooke’s law
  • Energy methods and virtual work
  • Torsion, bending, and beam theory
  • Failure criteria and plastic deformation

docs.title: Transverse Field Ising Model:
docs.text: ising.md

docs.title: Transverse Field Ising Model
docs.text: Numerical study of the transverse field Ising model (TFIM) for n spin-½ particles. The Hamiltonian is built and diagonalized using NumPy.

docs.title: Repository
docs.text: GitHub Repository

docs.title: Code
Results
docs.text:
• For n = 2 → E₀ ≈ −2.236
  • For n = 10 → E₀ ≈ −12.38 Energy per spin converges to ≈ −1.238. Memory grows as (2^{2n}), making diagonalization impractical for (n \gtrsim 19).

docs.title: Files
docs.text:
• ising.py: main script for Hamiltonian construction and diagonalization.
  • report.pdf: derivation and results summary.
